results.title: Central Asia: crossroads of culture
results.creator_credit: Tashkent Film Studios and M Raioumov
results.brief_description: In the heart of Asia can be seen traces of a great civilization. The Central Asian region formed part of the Kisham Empire, comparable in greatness with that of the Romans. This film shows the relatively unknown cultural heritage of Central Asia. Made in co-operation with UNESCO and with the assistance of the National Commissions for UNESCO of Afghanistan, India, Iran, Pakistan and the USSR.

results.title: Central America (Caribbean region II)
results.brief_description: The climate, geography, economic interdependence on the rest of the world, the industries, and the peoples of Central America, are studied briefly in this film. The region’s position and importance in the Carribbean area, and its political history from the time of Columbus to the present, are sketched with the aid of animated diagrams.

results.title: Central America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography of the Americas”.
Describes the three main topographical regions of Central America - hot lowlands, temperate plateau, and cool mountain lands. Shows effects of climate on inhabitants and crops. Shows how coffee is grown and shipped. Discusses the economic importance of the Panama Canal.

results.title: Center play. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Willis Reed, star centre of the New York Knicks gives an impressive demonstration of the techniques of rebounding for centres, of blocking out, faking, switching on the “pick”, and proper training techniques. Filmed at Reed’s summer basketball camp.

results.title: Center play. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Willis Reed, star centre of the New York Nicks, in the National Basketball Association demonstrates the art of the centre play. Fundamentals of shooting, the push shot, the jump shot, the hook shot, layup and free throw are included. Shows how the little man can gain an advantage in shooting over the bigger man, how shooting can be improved by the proper holding of the ball and concentration of the eye.

results.title: Centennial Park
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Susan Doring
results.brief_description: A look at Centennial Park in Sydney - its beauty and history, its importance to wildlife and the use people make of it. Photographer: Ross King. Narrated by Tim Eliott.

results.title: Centaur
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Susan Gibbard
results.brief_description: The camera-work, music and colours of this film combine to express the joy of horses and horsemanship. Filmed with members of the Canadian Equestrian Team and designed to capture the essence of the sport where horse and rider seem to move as one. (Awards: Reims, Yorkton, Chantilly)

results.title: Celtic tides
results.creator_credit: Gregory Hall, Cottonport Holdings, Nashmount Productions and Mark Hall
results.brief_description: Featuring footage from seventeen recorded tracks as a backdrop, ‘Celtic tides’ takes the viewer on a cultural journey through the origins of celtic music, including interviews with performers, fans and Celtic historians who all share a passion for this vibrant music scene and display a thorough knowledge of the music’s evolution. Individual songs and performers on the tape include: Drunken piper” (Natalie MacMaster and Cookie Rankin), “An Innis aigh (The Chieftans, The Rankin Family), “Theme from Harry’s game” (Clannad), “Ta me mo shui” (Altan), “Flesh & blood” (Mary Black), “O’Neill’s march” (The Chieftans), “Step dance” (The Rankin Family), “Jack Daniels” (Natalie MacMaster), “Brenda Stubbert” (Ashley MacIsaac), “Boxty set” (Altan), “Traditional” (Old Blind Dogs), “A Cur nan goghar as a chreig” (Capercaillie), “Sleepy Maggie” (Ashley MacIsaac), “Caledonia” (Dougie MacLean), “Lady of Shalott” (Loreena McKennitt), “Seamus piping” (Seamus Egan), “E Horo” (Mary Jane Lamond). Hosted by the Rankin family.

results.title: Celtic spirits
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and James Littleton
results.brief_description: It is through music, rather than through battles or political events, that Canada’s Celtic heritage is explored. Folk-singer John Allan Cameron and fiddler Winston “Scotty” Fitzgerald, well-known Cape Breton musicians, are the on-camera guides and performers in this film about the roots of Celtic music. Against the backdrop of the rugged Scottish Highlands, the misty mountains of Ireland, and at Canadian folk festivals, an impressive array of familiar tunes is performed.
